name: Alspaugh, Robert W.
employer: KPMG International (retired); Board Director, Triton International Ltd.
title: Former CEO, KPMG International; Independent Director
notes: Robert W. Alspaugh had a 36-year career with KPMG LLP, serving as CEO of KPMG International from 2002 to 2006 and as Deputy Chairman and COO of KPMG US. He subsequently served on the boards of Ball Corporation, Triton International, Autoliv, and Veoneer.

name: Atkinson, James B.
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical information found. Multiple individuals named James B. Atkinson exist in public records but none confirmed as this Outpost member.

name: Berce, Kevin Prescott
title: Senior Director, Federal
notes: Kevin Berce is Senior Director, Federal at NVIDIA Corporation, based in the San Francisco Bay Area, focusing on federal government accounts and cybersecurity initiatives.

name: Besser, Kenneth Holt
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical information found for Kenneth Holt Besser.

name: Borwick, Jamie
title: 5th Baron Borwick; Conservative Peer
notes: Geoffrey Robert James Borwick, 5th Baron Borwick (born 1955), is a British businessman and hereditary peer elected to the House of Lords in 2013. He was CEO of Manganese Bronze Holdings (maker of London Taxis) 1987-2001 and founder of electric truck producer Modec. He is a Trustee of the Royal Brompton and Harefield Hospitals Charity.
ngos: Trustee, Royal Brompton and Harefield Hospitals Charity

name: Boury, Nissan
title: Managing Director and Co-Founder
notes: Nissan Boury co-founded Claremont Capital Corporation in 1992 and has managed the Madison Group L.P., a private equity fund initially launched with $120 million in committed capital, with over four decades of investment experience in venture capital and private equity.

name: Bowman, Michael L.
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical information found specifically for Michael L. Bowman as an Outpost member. Multiple individuals with this name exist in public records.

name: Brooks, Conley Jr.
title: Executive Chairman
notes: Conley Brooks Jr. brings nearly 40 years of experience in family office leadership and organizational vision. He holds a B.A. from Yale and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School. He joined the Marbrook Foundation board in 1975 and served as Executive Director from 1983 to 2006. His family has been involved since 1915 with Brooks-Scanlon and Brooks Resources.
ngos: Marbrook Foundation (Board Chair); Minneapolis Heart Institute Foundation

name: Carmona, Richard H.
employer: Canyon Ranch; University of Arizona; McKesson Corporation
title: Chief of Health Innovations, Canyon Ranch; Distinguished Professor, University of Arizona; Independent Director, McKesson
notes: Dr. Richard H. Carmona served as the 17th U.S. Surgeon General (2002-2006), the first Hispanic man in that role. He is a decorated Vietnam veteran, UCSF medical graduate (1979), and former Pima County Sheriff's Department surgeon. He later became Vice Chairman of Canyon Ranch. He joined McKesson's board as an independent director in September 2021 and previously served on boards of Clorox, Herbalife, and Taser International.
ngos: Canyon Ranch Institute (President); University of Arizona Zuckerman College of Public Health (Distinguished Professor)

name: Crossley, John Parshley III
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for John Parshley Crossley III as a prominent executive or public figure.

name: Elliott, William G. III
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical information found specifically for William G. Elliott III as an Outpost member.

name: Finger, Richard B.
title: Partner; Options Trader
notes: Richard B. Finger (born 1956) has been a full-time equity options trader in Houston, Texas, for over 25 years with a focus on naked put selling and spread trading. His background spans commercial banking, real estate, oil and gas, and derivative investments. He is a partner at Ariadne Capital LLC.

name: Fogelsong, Norman A.
title: Advisory Partner / General Partner (retired)
notes: Norman Fogelsong joined IVP in March 1989 as a General Partner and founded IVP's Later-Stage & Public Market Investment Group. He started his career at Hewlett-Packard, then McKinsey & Company. He earned a B.S. from Stanford, an M.B.A., and J.D. from Harvard. He was elected to the NVCA Board of Directors in 2010.
ngos: National Venture Capital Association (Board); Children's Health Council (Treasurer)

name: Foley, Steve USN (Ret.)
title: Executive Vice President; Retired U.S. Navy Captain
notes: Steve Foley is a retired U.S. Navy Captain and former commander of the Blue Angels flight demonstration team. He holds a B.A. from Hamilton College and an M.S. in National Security and Strategic Studies from the Naval War College. After retiring from 27 years of service, he joined Check-6 and later Solairus Aviation as Executive Vice President.

name: Graffis, Kevin Highley
title: Elementary School Principal
notes: Kevin Highley Graffis is one of the three sons of Richard Graffis (1932-2015) of Orinda, CA. He played as a guard at Washington State and had a USFL career (1983-84) with the Oakland Invaders before pursuing a career in education.

name: Graffis, Patrick D.
title: Unknown
notes: Patrick D. Graffis is one of the three sons of Richard Graffis (1932-2015) of Orinda, CA. No additional public biographical information found.

name: Graffis, Richard M.
title: Unknown
notes: Richard M. Graffis (1932-2015) of Orinda, CA was an enthusiastic volunteer and leader for charitable organizations including Guide Dogs for the Blind (Board Chairman for two years). He was a long-serving chairman of the Borrego Springs Health Society and served on the Kappa Sigma Fraternity alumni board at UC Berkeley.
ngos: Guide Dogs for the Blind (Board Chairman); Borrego Springs Health Society (Chairman)

name: Gustavson, Carl D.
title: Unknown
notes: No public biographical information found for Carl D. Gustavson as a prominent executive in California.

name: Hockenberry, Tim
title: Singer-Songwriter; Bohemian Club Entertainer
notes: Tim Hockenberry (born June 13, 1962) is a singer-songwriter and musician based in Northern California. He recorded and toured with the Trans-Siberian Orchestra and Mickey Hart of the Grateful Dead. He reached the semi-finals on America's Got Talent in 2012 and is a member of the Bohemian Club, performing at the Grove.

name: Kelly, James Andrew
title: Chairman of the Board and President Emeritus
notes: James Andrew Kelly (born September 15, 1936) served as U.S. Assistant Secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs (2001-2005) under President George W. Bush. A U.S. Navy captain and veteran, he also served as special assistant for national security to President Reagan and as president of Pacific Forum CSIS (1994-2001). He holds degrees from the Naval Academy and Harvard Business School.
ngos: Pacific Forum / CSIS (Chairman Emeritus); Asia Foundation (Board)

name: Kingery, Robert F.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Robert F. Kingery as an Outpost member.

name: Levy, Jay A.
title: Professor Emeritus, Department of Medicine
notes: Dr. Jay A. Levy is a pioneering virologist at UCSF who independently co-discovered HIV in 1983 (calling it ARV). He has been a full professor at UCSF since 1985, published over 600 scientific articles, and is a Fellow of the American Academy of Arts and Sciences. He has made key discoveries about HIV in the brain, CD8+ lymphocyte antiviral responses, and heat treatment of clotting factors.
ngos: American Foundation for AIDS Research (AmFAR)

name: Livingston, Philip B.
title: Co-Owner / Corporate Director
notes: Philip B. Livingston is a former NFL player (Oakland Raiders, 1981 Super Bowl), CPA, and CFO of multiple companies. He served as President of Financial Executives International (1999-2003) and was a key contributor to the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002. He later served as CFO of World Wrestling Entertainment and has been a director of numerous public companies.
ngos: Financial Executives International (FEI) (former President)

name: Lyons, Irving F. III
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Irving F. Lyons III as a prominent executive.

name: McGleenan, John
title: President and Owner
notes: John McGleenan is President and Owner of One Union Recording Studios in San Francisco, a premier post-production studio established in 1995 specializing in ADR, voice-over, sound design, and mixing. He previously served as Director of the San Francisco Fleet Week Association.
ngos: San Francisco Fleet Week Association (former Director)

name: Miller, Russell D.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Russell D. Miller as an Outpost member.

name: Molnar, David M.
title: Managing Director and Partner
notes: David M. Molnar is a Managing Director and Partner at Crest Capital Advisors (previously Hightower San Diego), which he co-founded in 2012. He has spent 30 years in finance and holds a B.S. in Quantitative Economics and Decision Sciences from UC San Diego. He is a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER.

name: Moran, Robert Matthew Jr.
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Robert Matthew Moran Jr. as an Outpost member.

name: Qvale, Bruce
title: President and CEO
notes: Bruce Qvale (born c. 1958) is the son of Norwegian-American automotive pioneer Kjell Qvale (1919-2013). He rose to become President and CEO of Qvale Auto Group, which had 15 dealership franchises across the U.S. He also founded the Qvale automobile manufacturer in 2000 (producing the Mangusta/De Tomaso Bigua) and has served on Audi's dealer council. The group has been selling off dealerships since 2020.
political_donations: Democratic donor; Virginia political donation records on file

name: Robbins, Robert C.
title: Distinguished Visiting Fellow; Former President, University of Arizona
notes: Dr. Robert C. Robbins (born November 20, 1957) is a cardiothoracic surgeon and the former 22nd President of the University of Arizona (2017-2024). He previously chaired the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery at Stanford and served as President and CEO of the Texas Medical Center (2012-2017). He is a long-standing board member at Modine Manufacturing Company and serves on the Council on Competitiveness.
ngos: American Heart Association (former Board, Western States Affiliate); Universities Research Association (Board of Trustees); Council on Competitiveness

name: Schnitzer, Jordan D.
title: President and CEO
notes: Jordan D. Schnitzer is President and CEO of Schnitzer Properties, one of the West Coast's top 10 private real estate owners with 31 million square feet across six Western states. He is also North America's foremost print collector with over 13,000 works. In 1997, he founded the Jordan Schnitzer Family Foundation and has donated $10 million to Portland State University's school of art. He hosted a 2016 fundraiser for Hillary Clinton at his Portland home and is a known Democratic donor.
ngos: Jordan Schnitzer Family Foundation (Founder); Harold & Arlene Schnitzer CARE Foundation
political_donations: Democratic donor; hosted Clinton 2016 fundraiser; $1,000 to Democratic Party of Oregon (1996); Schnitzer Properties PAC on OpenSecrets

name: Atkinson, Franklyn R.
title: Unknown
notes: A Franklyn Rehm Atkinson obituary appears in Palo Alto Online, linking him to Stanford sports supporters, but no executive biography confirmed.

name: Boardman, Eric Charles
title: Television Host and Producer
notes: Eric Charles Boardman grew up in Chicago, Illinois and holds a Psychology degree from Lake Forest College. He has hosted various educational children's video series including 'Prehistoric World' and 'Dinosaurs, Dinosaurs, Dinosaurs' (1987). He is also associated with Home and Garden TV programming.

name: Deisseroth, Karl
title: D.H. Chen Foundation Professor of Bioengineering; Professor of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences
notes: Dr. Karl Alexander Deisseroth (born November 18, 1971) is the inventor of optogenetics and co-developer of CLARITY tissue chemistry. He earned his A.B. from Harvard (1992) and MD-PhD from Stanford (1998). A Howard Hughes Medical Institute investigator since 2009, he is a member of the National Academy of Sciences and National Academy of Medicine and has received the Lasker Award (2021) and Horwitz Prize (2022). He is married to neuroscientist Michelle Monje.
ngos: MapLight Therapeutics (Scientific Advisor); ClearLight Biotechnologies (Founder & Scientific Advisor); Bright Minds Biosciences (Scientific Advisory Board); Stellaromics (Co-Founder & Scientific Advisor)

name: Erskine, R. Andrew
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for R. Andrew Erskine as a Silverado Squatters member. Multiple attorneys named Andrew Erskine practice in California.

name: Everdell, Coburn D.
title: Architect (AIA)
notes: Coburn D. Everdell, AIA, is an architect based in San Francisco. He graduated from Colgate University and holds a master's degree in product design from the Institute of Design at the Illinois Institute of Technology. He is a member of the Institute of Classical Architecture and Art (ICAA) and a Member of the Corporation at Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI).
ngos: Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI) Member of Corporation; Institute of Classical Architecture and Art (ICAA)

name: Faggioli, Justin M.
title: Ranch Co-Proprietor; Vice Chairman/Director, E.D. Bullard Co.
notes: Justin M. Faggioli holds a B.S. and M.S. from Stanford University and an M.B.A. from Harvard Business School. He has served as CEO of Niman Ranch, EVP of Ravenswood Winery, and Director of Sitka Inc. He manages family ranches and vineyards in Sonoma and Tulare counties and served as Mayor of Belvedere, CA. He is Board Chair of Save the Redwoods League.
ngos: Save the Redwoods League (Board Chair); The Thacher School (former President/Trustee); Family Winemakers of California (former President)

name: Gamble, Mark D.

notes: No specific public biographical information found for Mark D. Gamble as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Ganz, Michael A.

notes: No specific public biographical information found for Michael A. Ganz as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Garlinghouse, Richard E. Jr.
title: Principal and Co-Founder
notes: Richard E. Garlinghouse Jr. is Principal and Co-Founder of The Presidio Group LLC, an automotive investment banking firm based in San Francisco. He holds a B.S. and M.Arch. from Stanford University and previously co-founded Southwest Diversified. He is retired and living in St. Helena, CA.

name: Goodan, Roger
title: Unknown
notes: Roger Goodan appears in BoardroomAlpha profiles but public details are limited. The name is associated historically with a California family (Roger Goodan 1890-1943, who owned the Goodan Ranch in San Diego County), but the specific current member identity and occupation is unconfirmed.

name: Healy, Patrick V
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Patrick V. Healy as a Silverado Squatters member (distinct from the Patrick Healy who is CEO of Hellman & Friedman).

name: Kramer, John
title: Managing Member
notes: John Kramer is a Managing Member of KRG, LLC (founded 2010), focused on investment research and wealth management. He previously founded and served as President and Co-Chief Investment Officer of Kensington Investment Group (1993-2010), which managed over $1 billion. He began his career at Townsend-Greenspan & Co. (Alan Greenspan's firm) and holds an M.B.A. from UC Berkeley.

name: Lawrence, Steven Ernest
title: Research Director / Senior Consultant
notes: Steven Ernest Lawrence is a national expert in foundation philanthropy who spent over two decades as Director of Research at Foundation Center. He has led research on human rights, social justice, health policy, and mission investing. He holds a B.A. from Cornell University and an M.A. in sociology from the University of Chicago.
ngos: Funders for Lesbian and Gay Issues (Board of Directors); Grantmakers in the Arts (Research Committee)

name: Luce, John M.
title: Emeritus Professor of Clinical Medicine; Former Chief Medical Officer, San Francisco General Hospital
notes: Dr. John M. Luce is an Emeritus Professor of Clinical Medicine at UCSF and former Chief Medical Officer at San Francisco General Hospital. He specializes in critical care medicine, internal medicine, and pulmonology, with 52 years of medical experience. He was a journalist before attending medical school at UCSF (graduated 1974).

name: Lurie, Robert A.
title: Real Estate Executive; Former Owner, San Francisco Giants
notes: Robert Alfred Lurie (born January 29, 1929) is a San Francisco real estate magnate and philanthropist who owned the San Francisco Giants from 1976 to 1993, having rescued the team from a move to Toronto. He took over his father's real estate company in 1972, building it to over 4 million square feet. The Connie and Bob Lurie Foundation has assets of approximately $84.9 million.
ngos: Connie and Bob Lurie Foundation (Founder); Louis R. Lurie Foundation

name: Martin, John F
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for John F. Martin as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Martin, Joseph John M.D.
title: Emeritus Dean; Edward R. and Anne G. Lefler Professor of Neurobiology
notes: Dr. Joseph Boyd Martin (born October 20, 1938, Bassano, Alberta) is an eminent neurologist and former Dean of Harvard Medical School (1997-2007). He previously served as Dean of the UCSF School of Medicine (1989-1993) and Chancellor of UCSF. He trained at the University of Alberta, Case Western Reserve, and the University of Rochester (Ph.D. anatomy 1971). He is a member of the Institute of Medicine of the National Academy of Sciences.
ngos: Dana Alliance for Brain Initiatives; American Academy of Arts and Sciences

name: Nim, Kenneth
employer: San Francisco Office of Economic and Workforce Development
title: Director, CityBuild
notes: Kenneth (Ken) Nim is the Director of CityBuild, San Francisco's nationally recognized construction trades job training program, and the first Asian American Pacific Islander to lead the program. His family arrived as Vietnamese-Chinese refugees in 1986. He holds a Master of Science in Organization Development from the University of San Francisco.
ngos: CityBuild Academy; San Francisco First Source Hiring Program

name: Rose, Anthony Frederick
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Anthony Frederick Rose as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Sagal, Peter D.
title: Host, Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!
notes: Peter D. Sagal is the host of NPR's popular weekly quiz show Wait Wait... Don't Tell Me!, a position he has held since 1998. He is a Harvard graduate (English literature) from Berkeley Heights, NJ, and has a background in playwriting, stage direction, journalism, and travel writing. The show has won a Peabody Award (2007) and is heard by nearly three million weekly listeners.

name: Sherman, Robert S. III
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Robert S. Sherman III as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Simons, Carlton Barrett
title: Unknown
notes: No specific public biographical information found for Carlton Barrett Simons as a Silverado Squatters member.

name: Steinhart, Peter
title: Naturalist, Writer, and Former Audubon Editor
notes: Peter Steinhart (born August 17, 1943, San Francisco) is a naturalist and writer who served as editor and columnist at Audubon magazine for twelve years and as an environmental affairs columnist for California magazine. He received a B.A. from Stanford (1965) and an M.A. from UCLA (1967). His books include The Company of Wolves and The Undressed Art: Why We Draw. He lives in Palo Alto.

name: Sylla, John R.
title: Entrepreneur and Venture Capitalist; President, American Institute of Bisexuality
notes: John R. Sylla (born February 8, 1959) received an A.B. in engineering and applied sciences from Harvard (1981) and a J.D.-M.B.A. from the University of Chicago (1985). He began his career in venture capital law at Cooley Godward and later became an entrepreneur and investor in software, education, marketing, and entertainment. He taught business law at the University of Chicago Booth School of Business from 1999 to 2014.
ngos: American Institute of Bisexuality (President); Fritz Klein Foundation (President)

name: Symonds, J. Taft
employer: Symonds Investment Company / Plains All American Pipeline LP
title: Chairman, Symonds Investment Co.; Independent Director, Plains All American GP LLC
notes: J. Taft Symonds (born 1940) is a transportation and investment executive with backgrounds in merchant banking (Paine Webber, Robert Fleming Group, and Banque de la Societe Financiere Europeenne). He served as Chairman and CFO of Maurice Pincoffs Co. (1978-2004) and was an Independent Director of Plains All American Pipeline LP from 2001 to 2016. He holds a B.A. from Stanford and an M.B.A. from Harvard.
ngos: Houston Arboretum & Nature Center (Director)

name: Symonds, Jonathan T. II
title: Non-Executive Chairman of the Board
notes: Sir Jonathan Symonds CBE is a senior British financial executive who became Non-Executive Chairman of GSK's Board on September 1, 2019. He previously served as CFO of AstraZeneca (1997-2007), Partner and Managing Director at Goldman Sachs, CFO of Novartis AG (2009-2013), and Deputy Group Chairman of HSBC (2018-2020). He is a former Partner at KPMG. He was appointed CBE for services to business.
ngos: European Round Table of Industrialists (ERT); Oxford University Department of Pharmacology (Visiting Fellow)

name: Turner, Marshall C. Jr.
title: Independent Technology Venture Investor
notes: Marshall C. Turner Jr. holds a B.S. and M.S. from Stanford (1964, 1965) and an M.B.A. from Harvard (1970). He served as a White House Fellow, helped found the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, and served as CEO of Liquid Crystal Technology (1975-1980). He chaired the boards of the Smithsonian's National Museum of Natural History, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting (Reagan nominee), KQED Inc., and Reed Union School District.
ngos: Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History (Board Chair); Corporation for Public Broadcasting (Board); KQED Inc. (Board Chair); PBS (Board); George Lucas Educational Foundation (Board)

name: Wagener, Peter Davis
title: Relationship Manager
notes: Peter Davis Wagener is a Relationship Manager at First Republic Bank in the San Francisco Bay Area, with a background in regional banking management and relationship management at major financial institutions.
